page.title: 18Attitudes, Abermorddu Pupils
page.content: A school {survey}covering 160 pupils from the ages of 5 to 11, shows that only 49 pupils regularly attend church. This is 30%. Only 5 (3%) went occasionally, whilst 106 pupils (66%) never attended. Questioned as to why they did not attend, most pupils spoke of other attractions ({television, trips}) as the main reason for not going. The attitude of some was that church was boring and that as their parents did not go they shouldn't have to. It appears from the survey that even fewer parents attend regularly. Those who went to Sunday School regularly did so from enjoyment or because their parents want them to go. It seems that it is in {Primary {School}tyhat most pupils receive any form of religious education.
